Deficiency Narrative: During an inspection, an employee file did not contain two reference checks to determine employment suitability.
Correction Narrative: During an inspection, an employee file was reviewed and displayed two reference checks to determine employment suitability.

Deficiency Narrative: During an inspection, a caregiver was observed on the phone while transporting children in care.
Correction Narrative: During an inspection, all staff were attentive with the children during movie time and in ratio.

Deficiency Narrative: During an inspection, a caregiver was observed transporting six children in care.
Correction Narrative: During an inspection, all staff were attentive with the children during movie time and in ratio.

Deficiency Narrative: During an inspection I observed a disconnection notice that stated the gas had been disconnected due to nonpayment.
Correction Narrative: During an inspection the administrator provided documentation showing the gas is no longer disconnected.

Deficiency Narrative: During the inspection, the thermometer in the refrigerator measured 65 degrees.
Correction Narrative: The operation has replaced the faulty refrigerator. The new refrigerator was found to be in good repair with a working thermometer.

Deficiency Narrative: During the walkthrough of the outdoor area, used unemptied paint containers, a metal bed railing, and an air conditioner were observed in an area where children play.
The operation's water was disconnected four times within the last seven months due to non-payment.
Correction Narrative: The operation's water was in operating condition during the follow up inspection. The administrator stated she would be ensuring the utilities remain in compliance.

Deficiency Narrative: During an HM visit rotted wood was observed outside as well as a hole in the wall.
Correction Narrative: During the follow up inspection I observed the rotted wood has been removed and replaced. The hole in the wall has also been repaired.

Deficiency Narrative: During a review of a child's file there was not a Consent for Treatment with Psychotropic Medication in the file for Strattera which the child began taking on 9.15.24 after the doctor was contacted on 9.12.24 and the change was made to discontinue Intuniv and start Strattera.
Correction Narrative:
During a review of a child's file there was not a Consent for Treatment with Psychotropic Medication in the file for Strattera which the child began taking on 9.15.24 after the doctor was contacted on 9.12.24 and the change was made to discontinue Intuniv and start Strattera.

A written follow up was submitted and physical follow up was conducted at the operation. The consent form for Treatment with Psychotropic Medication was reviewed and there no concerns.

Deficiency Narrative:
During a review conducted on September 30, 2024, it was determined that: 

(1)    your operations administrator failed to ensure compliance with the current HM Plan(s); and 

(2)    12 months had elapsed since the effective date of the plan.

As you know, the heightened monitoring plans for your operation included a specific planned end date at the 12-month mark by which your operation was expected to meet all heightened monitoring criteria necessary to move out of active heightened monitoring to a phase of post plan monitoring.  As a direct result of the administrators failure to ensure timely compliance with heightened monitoring plans, your operation is now unable to successfully move to post-plan monitoring.  Furthermore, your operations planned end date must now be revised, and the period of heightened monitoring must be extended again. 

Further details of the failure of your operations administrator to ensure compliance include the following: 
- Operation was unable to meet compliance with Medium-High or High weighted licensing citations, including having an open investigation(s). 

Finding: 748.535(2)  The licensed administrator must ensure the operation complies with current heightened monitoring plans.
Correction Narrative: An HM extension was approved effective 9/30/2024.  In conjunction with this extension, a new deadline was established by which all requirements must be completed by your CPA/GRO in order for the operation to be released from its HM plan and move to the Post-plan Monitoring Stage of HM.  Because the extended deadline is now effective, HHSC has determined that the operation is compliant with the requirements of 26 TAC 748.535(2).  The HM deadline for your operation has been extended by 6 months and the new deadline is 3/30/2025.

Deficiency Narrative: It was determined that the operation did not follow the Attachment A that included a safety plan pertaining to a child not being able to share a room with certain residents.
Correction Narrative: During the exit interview, it was discussed that J.O will not be sharing a room with anyone and that was actually his first time. The administrator informed me that moving forward, if it does come that J.O has to share a room, they will ensure to follow his Attachment A. Also, during my inspection, I observed J.O to not be sharing a room with anyone.

(1)    your operations administrator failed to ensure compliance with the current HM Plan(s); and

As you know, the heightened monitoring plans for your operation included a specific planned end date at the 12-month mark by which your operation was expected to meet all heightened monitoring criteria necessary to move out of active heightened monitoring to a phase of post plan monitoring.  As a direct result of the administrators failure to ensure timely compliance with heightened monitoring plans, your operation is now unable to successfully move to post-plan monitoring.  Furthermore, your operations planned end date must now be revised, and the period of heightened monitoring must be extended again. 

Further details of the failure of your operations administrator to ensure compliance include the following: 
- Operation was unable to meet compliance with Medium-High or High weighted licensing citations, including having an open investigation(s). 

Finding: 748.535(2)  The licensed administrator must ensure the operation complies with current heightened monitoring plans.
Correction Narrative: An HM extension was approved effective 3/26/2024.  In conjunction with this extension, a new deadline was established by which all requirements must be completed by your CPA/GRO in order for the operation to be released from its HM plan and move to the Post-plan Monitoring Stage of HM.  Because the extended deadline is now effective, HHSC has determined that the operation is compliant with the requirements of 26 TAC 748.535(2).  The HM deadline for your operation has been extended by 6 months and the new deadline is 9/27/2024.

Deficiency Narrative: CCR arrived at the operation in December, after the incident occurred, and the operation did not have a written incident report to provide to CCR.
Correction Narrative: A corrective action was received from the operation that was shared with all staff members: "All staff at Rob and Simon's Hawthorne House are required to complete a serious incident report when administering first aid to a youth. Attached is the serious incident report policy. Utilize this as a refresher on the serious incident reporting protocol. These documents will remain on the board in the kitchen for immediate daily access."

Deficiency Narrative: Based on the review of the investigation it was determined that a restraint was conducted and witnesses other than direct care staff were present.
Correction Narrative: Based on the review of the investigation it was determined that a restraint was conducted and witnesses other than direct care staff were present.

Deficiency Narrative: Based on the review of the investigation it was determined one staff member was left with a group of 10 children due to a second staff member leaving to assist another staff member with a restraint.
Correction Narrative: Based on the review of the investigation it was determined one staff member was left with a group of 10 children due to a second staff member leaving to assist another staff member with a restraint.

Deficiency Narrative: During a Heightened Monitoring visit the administrator stated that 3 children were positive for COVID however this was not reported.
Correction Narrative: During a Heightened Monitoring visit the administrator stated that 3 children were positive for COVID however this was not reported.

Deficiency Narrative: Medication was signed and documented as given prior to the child receiving the medication making the count inaccurate.
Correction Narrative: En email was sent stating, Rob and Simon's Hawthorne House will ensure that medication is signed out after administration of medication to children in care.  Administrator will follow-up to ensure that signatures and count is correct, and that there are no medication errors. During a HM inspection the operation proved no concerns regarding medication review.

Deficiency Narrative: Child in care did not receive prescribed medication for 3 days due to running out of refills.
Correction Narrative:
Medication logs were viewed for 3 children and found to be in compliance. A medication count was also completed. The operation is keeping track of refills using the medication audit system they have in place. 

Written correction received from the operation: Rob & Simon's Hawthorne House will ensure that refills are ordered and received timely.  Refills will be reviewed in daily staffings to ensure the refills are ordered 15 days before the resident is out.

Deficiency Narrative: It was observed during the backyard walk through that the operation had one loose brown wood post in the yard, and four new light brown playground box post next to the metal shed.
Two children in care reported a staff bent a child's fingers backwards as a form of punishment.
Correction Narrative:
Physical-Interviews of the children at Ford Elementary. Interviews are available in the Contacts.

Written correction received on 2/24/22
Rob & Simons Hawthorne House will continue to train Caregivers in Discipline and Punishment.  Discipline and Punishment will also be communicated with staff during the beginning of each shift and at Staff Meetings.  Administrator, House Manager, and Compliance will ensure this task is being communicated to staff.

Deficiency Narrative: Parent orientation information is missing from 2 of 4 children's files reviewed.
Correction Narrative: Parent orientation information is missing from 2 of 4 children's files reviewed.

Deficiency Narrative: Two of 4 forms were missing their orientation checklist outside of the allotted timeframe.
Correction Narrative: Two of 4 forms were missing their orientation checklist outside of the allotted timeframe.

Deficiency Narrative: 2 of 4 contraindication forms were missing from the binders.
Correction Narrative: 2 of 4 contraindication forms were missing from the binders.

Deficiency Narrative: It was observed during the walk through that the operation had food being thawed in the kitchen sink.
Children interviewed by A/N Investigator reported restraints with their limbs placed behind their back.
Correction Narrative:
The staff member involved in this incident is no longer employed with Rob & Simons Hawthorne House.  Rob & Simons Hawthorne House will continue to train in De-escalation/EBIs, as well as Safety when a restraint is necessary. Campus Manager, Compliance and Supervisors will ensure that staff are properly using the proper EBI/ De-escalation methods.

Physical Follow up:
On 4/13/22, 3 of 3 children were interviewed at Ford Elementary from Rob & Simon Hawthorne House. Three of 3 children stated they have not seen or heard of any physical discipline has taken place at Hawthorne involving a restraint placed behind their back. Interviews will be available in the Chrono.

Deficiency Narrative: A serious incident report reviewed did not contain information of  a short personal restraint that had been implemented. That incident report was signed by a staff member that had acknowledged the restraint had taken place.
Correction Narrative: Rob & Simons Hawthorne House has assigned PLSP, and Compliance to follow-up on Serious Incident reports to ensure that reports are true, accurate, and complete. The staff member involved in this incident is no longer with Rob & Simons Hawthorne House. Administrator, PLSP, and compliance will ensure that reports are complete.

Deficiency Narrative: Serious incident documentation did not indicate that a restraint occurred, or include that the injury was a result of a short personal restraint.
Correction Narrative: Rob & Simons Hawthorne House staff have been retrained in the importance of detail on a Serious Incident Report. Incidents as well as Incident Reports are monitored and reviewed by Supervisor as well as Campus Manager.  Administrator, Campus Manager, Compliance, Supervisor and PLSP will ensure that if a restraint is necessary, it will be done properly.

Deficiency Narrative: Staff members failed to report suspected abuse and neglect or exploration of a child in care after observing lumps on the child's head.
Correction Narrative:
Rob & Simons Hawthorne House will ensure that allegations or indications of abuse, neglect, or exploitation of a child is called in to the hot line as well as reported to licensing representatives. Discussions of the importance of reporting, abuse, neglect, or exploitation has been added to house 
meetings as well as monthly staff meetings to ensure the incidents are called in as soon as a staff member is aware.  The staff member involved in this incident is no longer employed with Rob & Simons Hawthorne House. Administrator, Campus Manager, Compliance, Supervisor and PLSP will ensure that if a restraint is necessary, it will be done properly.

Deficiency Narrative: A caregiver placed his hands around a child's neck impeding the child's breathing. Also, it was not determined that the situation constituted an emergency, the caregiver failed to minimized the risk of physical discomfort, harm/pain during the restraint, and failed to use the minimal amount of reasonable and necessary physical force. It was also determined that the EBI was used as retaliation for the child throwing  a brick at the staff member.
Correction Narrative:
On 2/1/22 current residents were interviewed and no concerns were expressed. 
2/2/22: Rob & Simons Hawthorne House has staff in place to ensure that if an EBI is necessary, it will be done properly. EBIs are reviewed at monthly staff meetings, and Staff are trained by in house trainers monthly an external trainer every three months. The staff member involved in this incident is no longer employed with Rob & Simons Hawthorne House.  Administrator, Campus Manager, Compliance, Supervisor and PLSP will ensure that if a restraint is necessary, it will be done properly.

Deficiency Narrative: Staff violated a child in care from their right to be free of abuse, neglect and exploitation. Staff physically endangered a child in care.
Correction Narrative: Per BGC the staff was made Inactive as of 06/29/2021. Per the operation, the staff member involved in this incident is no longer employed with Rob & Simons Hawthorne House.  Rob & Simons Hawthorne House will continue to ensure that staff adhere to childrens rights. Staff have been put in place to monitor children and staff to ensure that all children in care are free of abuse, neglect and exploitation.  Administrator, Campus Manager, Compliance, and Supervisors will be responsible that staff adhere to Childrens Rights.

Deficiency Narrative: Staff used an EBI as a means to get a child to comply.
Correction Narrative:
On 2/1/22 current residents were interviewed and no concerns were expressed. 
2/2/22: Rob & Simons Hawthorne House has staff in place to monitor staff and children in care.  This ensures that staff members are following EBI company policies, as well as DFPS minimum standards. This also ensures that EBI is not used to get a child in care to comply. The staff member involved in this incident is no longer employed with Rob & Simons Hawthorne House.  Administrator, Campus Manager, Compliance, Supervisor and PLSP will ensure that if a restraint is necessary, it will be done properly.

Deficiency Narrative: According to the investigation, two staff were witnessed inappropriately grabbing children in the neck area of the shirts and using as a lever/device to control the children.
Correction Narrative:
The following is from Rob & Simon Hawthorne House: We are submitting this correction as a requirement, but this does not waive our due process rights. The staff member involved in this incident is no longer employed with Rob & Simons Hawthorne House.  Rob & Simons Hawthorne House will continue to train staff in Childrens Rights and ensure that staff are following Childrens Rights and Other Prohibited Punishment.

Physical Follow-up @ Ford Elementary by Donte Evangelista on 5/10/22:  
Three of three children were interviewed face to face at Ford Elementary. Three of three children stated no restraints, physical discipline or corporal punishment including anyone being grabbed inappropriately.

Deficiency Narrative: Service plan for the child was not followed. The child was placed in a room with younger children.
Correction Narrative:
The operation requested an admin review. Compliance met by the operation on 2/4/22. The operation provided correction with the following: 
Rob & Simons Hawthorne House Treatment Director will ensure that Initial Service Plan is reviewed and followed by team members no later than 15 days after Service Plan meeting.  Service Plans will be reviewed and signed in weekly meetings.  Treatment Director and Case Manager will be responsible for this task.  Administrator will follow-up to ensure Service Plan is being followed.
